title: Fulham's Ross McCormack hands in a transfer request after offer of non-playing role
title_page: Fulham's Ross McCormack hands in a transfer request after offer of non-playing role | Daily Mail Online
text:
Fulham have offered a revised contract in a bid to hang on to the forward
McCormack also wants to have a shot at promotion to the Premier League
Striker is understood to have no plans to retire at the age of just 32
Ross McCormack wants to quit Fulham after rejecting a non-playing deal
Ross McCormack has handed in a transfer request at Fulham off the back of the club offering him a contract that would see him take a non-playing role when he turns 32.
Sources close to the player have told Sportsmail that McCormack, 29, has: 'no wish to retire from playing the game he loves at 32.'
He also believes he deserves a chance of at least competing to get into the Barclays Premier League, an opportunity which Fulham cannot give him at this stage.
Ross McCormack has handed in a transfer request in a bid to find a way out of Fulham in the January window
McCormack has no intention of retiring, but a contract offer made to him included a future non-playing role
Middlesbrough are showing interest in the forward who wants to have a shot at Championship promotion
Fulham paid £10.75million to sign McCormack from Leeds United 18 months ago and hope to get all their money back before they let him leave.
It is understood that Fulham made McCormack a revised contract offer in a bid to persuade him to stay amid continued interest from Middlesbrough.
The forward has netted 15 goals in the Championship this season for 19th-placed Fulham but has told friends he is desperate to leave before the transfer window shuts on February 1.
But Fulham believe there would be little value in selling their top goalscorer while they are under a transfer embargo and just four points above the relegation zone.
McCormack has also netted two goals in the Capital One Cup this season, bringing him to 17 goals that almost matches last season's total of 19.
Fulham would want a return on the £10.75million they paid to sign McCormack from his former club Leeds
He only signed his current deal with Fulham in August, extending his stay in west Lodnon until 2019.
